channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roebock cottages end of Nailsworth terrace, 8th October
item.description:
The drain used to be functioning but neglect and silt has now blocked the drain so it is not even visable to eye. Blocked full of silt

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Milsom Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned caravan in layby, 8th October
item.description:
Abandoned caravan in the layby on the A435 Cirencester Rd out of Charlton Kings towards Cirencester. No number plate, looks dilapidated and has been in the same place for two weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Subsidence of road., 8th October
item.description:
The road has heavily subsided causing vehicles to dip severely as they pass the stretch of road. Trying to avoid the area of the road brings vehicles dangerously close to the centre carriage way markings. This has been a problem for some months now. Had to report as pothole as there were no other option headings.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: GCH had a trench dug and a pipe laid across Innsworth Lane from Rookery Road and the entire width of the repair across the road is now a pothole. This was a vert poor reinstatement job performed by whoever GCH had do the work., 8th October
item.description:
The juntcion of Rookery Road and Innsworth Lane across the width of the road to the new houses GCH have partially built and now appear to have left abandoned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
